name: River Trail
description: A quiet stretch of River Trail, where the faint path of packed earth meets the encroaching riverine flora. You are on the River Trail, a narrow track that seems to be losing its battle with the persistent willows and cattails. To the west, the rough-hewn Hubbard Track beckons. The air here carries the faint scent of damp earth and the distant call of a heron, a testament to nature's slow, inevitable reclamation. The occasional rustle in the reeds hints at unseen wildlife, or perhaps just the wind playing tricks.
